text: Blac Monks was an American southern hip hop group from Houston, Texas, consisting of 3-2, D.A. and Awol. In 1994, they released their debut album Secrets of the Hidden Temple via Rap-A-Lot Records, which also featured Quiet Storm (Assata Tafari) on the single "Buddha Nature". Assata and Raheem joined the group to release their sophomore album No Mercy. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Title ! rowspan="2"| Release ! colspan="2"| Peak chart positions |- ! scope="col" style=font-size:90%;"| US ! scope="col" style=font- size:90%;"| US R&B; |- ! scope="row"| Secrets of the Hidden Temple | * Released: 1994 * Label: Rap-A-Lot | style="text-align:center;" |— | style="text-align:center;" |65 |- ! scope="row"| No Mercy | * Released: 1998 * Label: Rap-A-Lot | style="text- align:center;" |— | style="text-align:center;" |74 |- | colspan="4" align="center" style="font-size:90%" | "—" denotes a recording that did not chart. |} ==See also== *Houston hip hop ==References== ==External links== * Black Monks discography at Discogs Category:African-American musical groups Category:Musical groups from Houston Category:Musical groups established in 1993 Category:Musical groups disestablished in 1998 Category:Rappers from Houston Category:American musical trios
